title: Wood Ear Mushroom
steps: Cover the dried wood ear mushrooms with boiling water.
Allow to steep for 15 minutes, or until rehydrated.
Strain and reserve as needed. You can optionally cut into thin strips if desired.
notes: This is a common topping in southern-style paitan soups, particularly tonkotsu.
It is bafflingly easy to make.
They're primarily for texture contrast, as they have little to no flavor.
Wood ear mushrooms provide a distinctive chewy, gelatinous texture.
Cutting into thin strips makes them easier to eat and distribute in the bowl.
